1.content:
Emily looked at the cover of the comic book at the garage sale. She liked the title, the description sounded interesting to her, and the picture of the main character on the front looked just like her. Emily bought the book, digging through her pocket for a quarter, and took it home to read.

After Emily got back to her house, the thirteen year old snuggled up in a comfortable chair and opened the book.

The first page was blank. Emily stared at the page in confusion. Her vision started to blur and warp, and the colors around her appeared to smear, so it was hard for her to see anything.

Her surroundings faded until all she could see was white. It took her a moment to realize she was looking at a wall. When Emily looked around, she seemed to be in the same place. Emily was no longer holding the comic book, but she didn't notice. In fact, she had forgotten all about the book.

Her best friend walked into the room. The teenage girl in the doorway seemed surprised.

"Sharon? What are you doing at my house?" Emily asked.

"I'm here to help you with the you-know-what," Sharon, Emily's friend told her, "And shouldn't you be downstairs?"

"Help me with what?" Emily asked, "And we have a basement? I didn't know that."

"Your, um, practicing. At the Training Room, remember?" Sharon said.

"I have no idea what you're talking about," Emily said as her mom entered the room.

"Oh, right," Sharon agreed suddenly, winking at Emily.


What name will people keep calling Emily?
1.title: The Comic Book

choices: can use extra life energy from surrounding to use telekineses and hone senses
Ice, and Sharon is a villain trying to obtain something from the lair
11.content:
Sharon turned around and started towards the kitchen. Emily didn't know what was going on, but she followed Sharon. Her best friend wouldn't betray her, right? Sharon opened the cupboard with the cooking dishes and pie tins, and reached around the back corner to press a button. The fridge swung outwards, revealing a gaping black hole.

"I never knew that was there," Emily exclaimed in surprise.
"You're joking, right? Seriously. You don't remember what happened Monday? I've been waiting all week to get back here." Sharon hurried down. "You coming, Kate? I'm gonna shut the door as soon as you come."
"My name isn't Kate. You must be mistaken." Emily tentatively approached the steps.
"I think I'd know my best friend's name. Kate Mckinney, sure as day." Emily started downwards.
"No it's Emily."
"Kate, exactly as I said." The fridge swung into place behind Emily.
"Emily."
"Kate."
"There must be something wrong with your ears."
"Doctor said he would give anything to have my ears."
Emily sighed. There was no arguing with Sharon. The steps were metal, impossible to walk quietly on. Soon she came to a point where the wall was replaced with metal bars. This place was designed for defense, Emily realized. The steps would allow you to hear intruders, and the metal bars made it easy for weapons to get in, but not out. At the bottom of the stairs there was what looked like a hand scanner.
"Come on, come on," Sharon urged. "It only works for you."
Emily put her hand on the scanner, and it flashed green in an instant. Sharon darted inside. The screen said:

"Welcome, user of the power [Emily's power]...

What is her power?
11.title: Kate McKinney

114.content:
Growth.

“Welcome MegaGirl.”
Kate looked around. All her gadgets looked dangerous.
“Sharon, am I a....a villain?”
“Of course silly.” Sharon says.
She then walks into another room. When she returns, she is carrying a large futuristic gun.
“Sharon? What are you doing!”
114.title: Super large

14.content:
"Hello, Mrs. Bryant," Sharon waved with one hand and grabbed Emily's arm with the other, "Goodbye, Mrs. Bryant!"

"Have fun, girls," Emily's mom laughed. Her short, red curls danced as she jangled her car keys and dashed out the door.

Emily shook Sharon's hand off her arm. Her friend had practically dug holes into her arm with her nails. Rubbing the tender spots with one hand, she frowned.

"What were you saying about a training room…?" Emily trailed off when Sharon rolled her eyes.

"Very funny, Breanne."

"Who?"

"C'mon, Breanne! I'm not in a joking mood. Dr. Dark is plotting to flunk all the seventh graders at Maple Middle School with his Stupid-Ray," She paused to push her glasses up her nose, "You need to train so you can be ready for him."

"Dr. Dark?" Emily's voice came out a squeak. "Who in the world is Dr. Dark?"

"Duh," Sharon rolled her eyes again, "Your latest nemesis? The supervillain that only wants to utterly destroy you…?"

Sharon crossed her arms over her chest and squinted at Emily's face.

"What's wrong with you, Breanne? You know all about Dr. Dark. The two of you have been battling since second grade!"

"What's wrong with me? Well, for starters, my name isn't Breanne. It's Emily. Secondly," Emily held up two shaky fingers, "I have no idea what you're talking about! Dr. Dark? Stupid-Rays? Battles? Is this some kind of joke? Is today April first?"

Sharon's jaw dropped. "You really don't know!"

Emily hugged her arms to her chest. She was starting to feel cold and wondered if she was going crazy.

"Did Dr. Eraser give you amnesia again?" Sharon accused as she flopped onto the couch.

"Dr. Eraser--"

"Never mind," Sharon bit her lip, "You wouldn't remember if he had, anyway…"

"Amnesia…again?" Emily hissed. "You mean this isn't the first time my memory's been wiped?!"

"Of course not," Sharon said matter-of-factly. She waved a dismissive hand, "This sort of thing happens all the time."

"Lovely," Emily grumbled. She sank onto the couch cushion next to her best friend and buried her face in her hands.

"Okay. How 'bout I sum up your life. Maybe something will spark your memory. At least, that's what worked last time," Sharon grinned. "Well, that and a piece of your mom's famous apple pie. There was something magical about that crust…"

Emily snapped her fingers in front of Sharon's glazed eyes. The teen startled and flushed in embarrassment.

"Sorry. Anyway, your name is Breanne Bryant. Not Emily," Sharon sniffed in disgust.

"What's wrong with the name Emily?" Emily questioned, lifting her head from her hands, "It's been my name for thirteen years and you never complained about it before."

"That's because it's not your name," Sharon repeated. "Look, this'll be a lot easier if you just go with the flow, ok? Your name is Breanne."

"Breanne…" The name tripped awkwardly over Emily's tongue.

"Okay," Sharon continued, "if Dr. Eraser erased your memory then this next one might be hard to believe but…you've got superpowers."

Breanne snorted, "Right!"

"Seriously. You've had them since you were seven and since then you've defeated a bunch of super bad guys."

Breanne lurched from the couch and began to pace back and forth across the living room.

"Dr. Dark? Dr. Eraser?" Breanne lifted an eyebrow. "They're bad guys?"

"Yup," Sharon nodded, "You've foiled them both from taking over the world about three times, now. You've also stopped Dr. Storm, Dr. Critter, and Trashman."

Breanne paused her pacing and giggled, "Are all the villains doctors?"

Sharon rubbed her chin as she thought. "All of 'em but Trashman, The Pig, and…" she frowned in concentration, "Oh, yeah, Dr. Who."

"Dr. Who?"

Sharon grinned, "Dr. Who is actually a good guy. He's helped us, on occasion…"

"And right now we're trying to defeat Dr. Dark…?"

"Exactly!" Sharon gushed, "You're catching on a lot faster than last time!"

Breanne cocked her head at her best friend, still not sure that what she was saying was real. It all felt like a dream.

"So," Breanna pursed her lips and raised an eyebrow, "Superpowers, eh?"

"You still don't believe me, do you?" Sharon pouted. "C'mon down to the basement, Bree. Come see your training room and tell me I'm lying."

Breanne felt a wriggle of curiosity.

"What kind of superpowers do I have, Sharon?"

Her friend grinned, "Come find out…"


---What are Breanne's superpowers?---
14.title: Breanne Bryant

143.content:
Breanne followed Sharon into her room.

"Why are we in here?" Breanne asked.

"This is where the passage is," Sharon told her.

Sharon stepped into the small closet and beckoned Breanne over. Breanne obediently squished herself in with her friend.

Sharon grabbed a red metal clothes hanger and gave it to Breanne.

"What do I do with this?" Breanne asked.

"Hang it back up," Sharon instructed.

Breanne raised her eyebrow, but silently hung the empty hanger back up. Just before Breanne did as she was told, Sharon closed the closet door.

Once hung back up, the red hanger turned purple and the back of the closet opened to reveal a spiral staircase. Breanne couldn't see anything past the first few stair steps because it was so dark down there. She even felt the coldness coming from downstairs, but even though she was cold, she felt comfortable and relaxed.

This is a weird feeling, Breanne thought.

"Come on!" Sharon called. Breanne hadn't noticed that her friend had already started walking down the stairs.

Breanne hurriedly followed Sharon, who was descending rapidly.

As Breanne lowered her foot to the floor, her foot became almost numb from the cold, even though she was wearing shoes, before it suddenly warmed up along with the rest of her body. Before Breanne could lower her other foot, she suddenly moved in the blink of an eye across the room. Since she hadn't been on flat ground, Breanne fell on her rear.

"What happened?" Breanne asked.

"You did it! Now let's see if you can do the other one," Sharon said. Then she called, "Start training! Amnesia level!"

"Who are you talking to?" Breanne asked.

"Fight. Me. Frostbite," said a mechanical voice from behind Breanne.

Breanne spun around, her brown hair flying through the air as she did so. The metalic adult-sized robot was carrying a wooden staff in both of its human-like hands.

"Sharon! Do we have a break-in?" Breanne called nervously.

"No, this is your training bot, level zero, which we installed after Dr. Eraser's second amnesia attack. Go ahead, fight it."

"I don't know how to fight it!"

"Um, okay how did you explain it to me before?" Sharon muttered to herself.

The metal robot hadn't moved in the entire time it had been there.

"Fight. Me. Frostbite," the robot repeated, spinning the wooden staff.

"Okay, I'll fight!" Breanne called. Then she mumbled, "Just as soon as I learn how."

That seemed to trigger the robot further because it started moving forward to Breanne. The robot kept moving to the young teen. Just as the spinning staff was a couple feet from Breanne's face, she crossed her arms over her face.

All of a sudden, the whirring from the staff ceased. Breanne opened her eyes and moved her arms. She saw the robot was frozen, the staff stuck to the bot's hands.

"What happened?" Breanne asked.

"You did it! You found your other power."

"Okay, so I am some sort of ice powered superhero?"

"Yeah, and teleportation."

Breanne concentrated, and found she could control where she teleported to pretty easily. However, in the two hours she practiced her two superpowers, she was still surprised by the sudden change of view each time she teleported. Breanne still wasn't sure whether or not she liked the tingle she felt through her arms and neck every time​ she made more ice.

Breanne teleported across the room, then stretched her arms out, trying to freeze the level two robot she had graduated to.

"Sharon, why isn't it working?" Breanne asked.

"Oh yeah. You told me once that right after teleporting and right before, you can't use your ice. There was some logic behind it, but I don't remember."

"Great" Breanne said, "How long does it take?"

"I think somewhere around a minute," Sharon told her.

Breanne was only able to freeze the robot one more time before lights started flashing red around the room.

"What's the deal?" Breanne asked.

Sharon turned around and tapped a computer screen a couple times.

"Dr. Dark is in the Science Museum," she exclaimed, "He must be stealing a piece for the Stupid-Ray! You've got to get there and stop him!"

"But I haven't had much training. If he's really as smart as you say, I won't have a chance against him. I should train more first."

"But this could be the last piece! You've got to go now !"



Will Breanne go and try to stop Dr. Dark or stay and practice more?
143.title: Ice and Teleportation

choices: Teleport and hope your freeze power charges quickly
1431.content:
Breanne sighed, "Fine. I'll go after Dr. Dark. But I don't think it's a good--"

"Great!" Sharon interrupted with a grin, "Let's get you ready to go!"

Breanne's jaw dropped in surprise when Sharon opened a hidden door to reveal a snow-white outfit and blue, knee-high boots.

"Is that…?"

"Your super-suit!" Sharon squealed.

Breanne reached out a hand and caressed the silky material. She inspected a matching blue and white mask before frowning.

"No cape?"

Sharon rolled her eyes, "Haven't you seen The Incredibles? Capes are a hindrance. No capes!"

In moments Breanne changed from an average teen to Frostbite, superhero! She couldn't help but stop and admire herself in the mirror hanging on the bathroom wall.

"Hurry up!" Sharon pounded on the door. "Dr. Dark could be escaping with the last piece of the Stupid-Ray at any moment!"

Breanne stepped out of the bathroom and curtsied.

"Ready to go?" Sharon asked.

"As ready as I'll ever be…" Breanne mumbled, "Where's the Science Museum?"

Sharon shoved her glasses up a notch on her nose and glanced at her computer.

"On the corner of Clark and Kent."

With a deep breath, Breanne closed her eyes and concentrated. When she opened them again, she was in front of the Science Museum.

Taking a moment to procrastinate, she checked out the street. It looked vaguely familiar to the town she remembered, but with a few subtle differences. She chuckled at how Stripes, her favorite candy store, was painted like a candy cane instead of the lavender color that Mrs. Percy loved. And instead of a barber shop next to the bank, there was a video arcade. She didn't realize kids still spent quarters on those old games...

"Earth to Bree!" a voice hissed in her ear.

Breanne startled and almost screamed.

"Sharon?"

"Oh, yeah," Sharon sounded embarrassed, "I forgot to mention the comms in your mask..."

"That would have been a good thing to know!" Breanne scowled. "You about gave me a heart attack!"

"Sorry…So what's the holdup? You've been standing in front of the building for five minutes now."

"You timed me?"

"That's my job," Sharon laughed, "to keep you on track, make sure you don't get killed, and send backup if needed."

"Backup?" Breanne perked up.

"You don't need it," Sharon assured her, "You've beat Dr. Dark before and you can do it again. So stop delaying and do it already!"

Breanne sighed and adjusted her mask. "Okay, okay…I'm going!"

In an instant Breanne had teleported through the front door and in another second she found herself knocked off balance by a sticky web. Landing on her rear, Breanne stared at the web in horror.

"Frostbite!" a low, gravely voice hissed, "So we meet again!"

Breanne looked up to see a figure dressed in a flowing black robe. His head was completely hidden by a hood and one hand was clad in a dark glove.

"S…s…spiderwebs?!" Breanne stuttered, "Your superpower is shooting spiderwebs?!"

"Well, yeah," Dr. Dark admitted. He cocked his head and his hood shifted with the movement.

"You've been fighting Dr. Eraser again, haven't you?" Dr. Dark laughed when Breanne clenched her teeth and glanced away in embarrassment.

"It doesn't matter," Breanne growled. She let her cold powers flood through her arms, freezing the web that was stuck to her. As soon as it was frozen she was able to smash it into tiny pieces.

"Well, as much as I would like to stick around and play, I think it's time for me to go. I've got a Stupid-Ray to assemble, you know."

He threw out a gloveless hand and web shot from his fingers. Breanne, anticipating the attack, teleported behind him. She held up a hand to freeze the doctor's feet in place, but nothing happened.

"You can't freeze after teleporting!" Sharon hissed in her ear.

"I forgot!" Breanne groaned. She tried to duck another stream of sticky web but it struck her arm. With another shot, Dr. Dark had her good and stuck to a stone pillar.

"Thanks for the missing link!" Dr. Dark chuckled, waving goodbye with a dinosaur tooth. "Get it? Missing link? And we're in a Science Museum?"

"Hilarious," Breanne snapped.

"Bree!" the shout from Sharon made Breanne's ear ring, "Catch him!"

Breanne thought for a moment. If she froze the web she could chase after Dr. Dark on foot…but she might not be able to catch up to him. Or she could teleport out of the webbing and catch up to him right away…but she'd temporarily lose her freezing ability. She bit her lip, uncertain as to what to do…
1431.title: Try to stop Dr. Dark

info.brief_description: When Emily opens a comic book, she gets sucked -- literally -- into the story!
info.description:
When Emily looks into a blank comic book, she gets sucked into the story. Emily discovers she is a real superhero, but only when she is in the book. Emily cannot leave the comic book before the story is finished.

While in the story, her friends still look like her friends and her mother still looks like her mother. The only differences between her in the story and her in real life is:

1. She's a superhero
2. Her name is different

Rules:

- All entries must be 13+ or lower -- E preferred
- Don't change the main character
- The character must have superpowers while in the story
- No one-line chapters. Chapters that are 300 words or more will get 500 GPs
- The main characters cannot die
- No random chapters, or chapters that don't make sense
- Use proper grammar, spelling, and punctuation, please. I am not looking for perfection, but I don't want a piece that people can't understand or have a hard time reading.
